medical_history.chief_complaint: Necrotic wounds associated with meningococcal sepsis and diabetes-related infections leading to severe tissue necrosis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began after a meningococcal sepsis episode in a 16-year-old male, leading to infectious necrosis of the hands and feet. He was febrile at admission. For another patient, symptoms evolved from a nonhealing wound on the left great toe, resulting in lower limb amputation due to infection.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 had no specified relevant past medical history at the time of the incident. Patient 2 had insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus and a significant smoking history (35 pack-years).
medical_history.social_history: Patient 2 had a smoking history of 35 pack-years.
